keyTakeaways: Reading is an active skill that can be systematically improved
Four levels of reading: elementary, inspectional, analytical, syntopical
Ask questions of books: What is it about? What is being said? Is it true? So what?
Different books demand different reading strategies
The goal of reading is understanding, not just information
summary_short: Mortimer Adler's classic guide teaches reading as an active skill. Four levels of reading—elementary to syntopical—equip readers to understand any book. A meta-education in how to learn from books.
summary_medium:
Why This Book Matters

Most of us were taught to read in childhood and never improved. Adler argues that reading difficult books requires specific techniques that can be learned.

The Four Levels

Elementary (basic literacy), Inspectional (systematic skimming), Analytical (thorough understanding), and Syntopical (comparing multiple books on a subject).

Analytical Reading

Classify the book. State what it's about. Outline its structure. Define its terms. Grasp its propositions. Follow its reasoning. Criticize fairly.
